course_description: The course examines the intersection of policing and politics. It addresses how politics influences the police and policing (e.g., stop-and-frisk) and how the police and policing influence politics (e.g., rhetoric of political campaigns, protests in response to killings of civilians, etc.).
sections: Class Nbr: 1998, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 7-8:15p, Instructor: M. Owens, Status: Open
